title: Ticket #7087: Make Travis-CI testing more Batlab-like
description:
Tweaks to the OpenSSL code (which is always somewhat fragile...) passed the Travis-CI builds but imploded on various Batlab platforms. Let's catch these earlier

  • Some OpenSSL code only triggered on non-PROPER builds (where we dlopen the security libraries). TODO: Add Fedora 28 / non-PROPER build.
  • Mac OS X 10.10 failed due to a missing OpenSSL flag which is not present in OpenSSL 0.9.8. TODO: Determine if we want to continue support for this.
remarks:
2019-Jun-03 15:57:08 by bbockelm:
For now, it appears that Travis-CI can support both of the missing platforms. I did a trivial change so Travis should break if either OpenSSL 0.9.8 or 1.1.0 fails.

The Travis support for Mac OS X 10.10 is going to be very time-limited: these builds warn that the support was scheduled to be removed 1 January 2019. I think those are living on borrowed time!

Will resolve this for now; we can revisit the platform build question separately. No part of this touches the release build so will skip version history.
